page.title: 13ECOLOGY AROUND TRURO
page.content: Cornwall enjoys mild wet winters so grass rarely stops growing, except when snow, a rarity for a winter here, falls. Summers are hot, but often have a fair amount of rain and strong westerly winds. These winds, which are usually commonplace, have caused some trees and bushes to grow at an angle. Many of the quite large fields are crossed by footpaths, which are not always signposted. Although pollution in this area is minimal, no part of the area has been the subject of any deliberate conservation project. Most of the area in our survey, as indicated before, is mainly grassland which is only interfered with for grazing purposes. We can therefore enjoy land that is mostly well-cared for by the farmers who use it. _____
